{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2014}} {{Infobox military structure |name = Antonio Bautista Air Base
Puerto Princesa Air Base |coordinates = {{Coord|09|44|32|N|118|45|31|E|name=Antonio Bautista Airbase}} |location = Located at [[Puerto Princesa]], [[Palawan]], [[Philippines]] |latd = 9.743274 |longd = 118.758844 |image = |caption = |type = Air Base |code = |built = March 21, 1975 |builder = {{flag|Philippines}} |materials = |height = |used = 1975 – Present (Philippines) |demolished = |condition = |ownership = {{PHI}} |controlledby = [[Philippine Air Force]]
[[United States Air Force]] (under jurisdiction of Enhanced Defense Cooperation Agreement) |commanders = |garrison = * 570th Composite Tactical Wing |battles= |events= }} {{Infobox airport | name = Airfield information | IATA = PPS | ICAO = RPVP | elevation-f = 71 | elevation-m = 22 | latd = 09 | latm = 44 | lats = 32 | latNS = N | longd= 118 | longm= 45 | longs= 31 | longEW= E | pushpin_map = Philippines | pushpin_map_caption = Location of Antonio Bautista Air Base in the Philippines | pushpin_label = PPS/RPVP | r1-number = 09/27 | r1-length-f = 8,530 | r1-length-m = 2,600 | r1-surface = Concrete }} ''' ''Antonio Bautista'' Air Base''' {{airport codes|PPS|RPVP}} is a Military Airbase located on [[Puerto Princesa]], [[Palawan]]. The base shares a single, 9,000 foot long runway with [[Puerto Princesa Airport]].{{cite web |url=http://www.globalsecurity.org/military/world/philippines/bautista.htm |title=Antonio Bautista Air Base |author= |date= |website=globalsecurity.org |publisher= |access-date=September 7, 2016 |quote=}}http://kalasagnglahi.angelfire.com/main_paf_bases.html ==World War II== USAAF units based here included: *Headquarters, [[XIII Fighter Command]] (1 March 1945 – November 1945) *[[42d Bombardment Group]] (March 1945 – January 1946) *[[347th Rescue Wing|347th Fighter Group]] (6 March – December 1945) *[[419th Night Fighter Squadron]] (6 March 1945 – 10 January 1946) *[[550th Night Fighter Squadron]] (DET) (9–19 June 1945) ==Future Improvements== It is one of the nine air bases eyed for the priority development programs of the [[Philippine Air Force|Philippine Air Force (PAF)]]. The PAF planned to construct Two additional hangars at ''Antonio Bautista'' Air Base in Puerto Princesa to store relief supplies and accommodate additional air assets, including long-range patrol aircraft to be stationed there in the future. http://www.interaksyon.com/article/57143/air-force-to-beef-up-capabilities-in-palawan On March 18, 2016 the USA and Philippines signed a deal to allow US forces to use 5 bases in the country as a counter to the Chinese deployments in the Spratly Islands, including Antonio Bautista Air Base.https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/checkpoint/wp/2016/03/21/these-are-the-new-u-s-military-bases-near-the-south-china-sea-china-isnt-impressed/ ==References== {{reflist}} ==See also== * [[Puerto Princesa International Airport]] {{Military Bases of the Philippines}} [[Category:Air force installations of the Philippines]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Puerto Princesa]]
